greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of sum-full subsets of {1,...,n}; subsets A such that there is a solution to x+y=z for x,y,z in A.
comment: In sumset notation, number of subsets A of {1,...,n} such that the intersection of A and 2A is nonempty.
link: Fausto A. C. Cariboni, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..88
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Sum-Free Set
xref: Cf. A007865 (number of sum-free subsets of 1..n).
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, Apr 20 2004
ext: Terms a(31) and beyond from _Fausto A. C. Cariboni_, Oct 01 2020
